input._comment: NOTE: RECIPES TYPES CAN RESTRICT THE USE OF CERTAIN IMPLICIT OBJECTS LIKE count
input._comment2: EITHER BY OUTRIGHT DENYING THE OBJECT COMPLETELY, OR EXPECTING A VALUE WITHIN A CERTAIN RANGE, THROWING OTHERWISE
input._comment3: NOTE 2: item IS IMPLICIT, AND DOES NOT REQUIRE EXPLICITLY DEFINING THE TYPE
input._comment4: NOTE 3: (meta = -1) MATCHES **ALL** METADATA VALUES. THIS CAN BE BACKFIRE HORRIBLY, SO ****USE WITH EXTREME FUCKING CARE****

tool._comment: NOTE: ore_dict IS IMPLICIT, AND DOES NOT REQUIRE EXPLICITLY DEFINING THE TYPE

results._comment: NOTE: CHANCE CAN ONLY EVER BE AN INTEGER, 0-100
results._comment2: AND WILL THROW AT DESERIALIZATION IF THIS IS NOT THE CASE (i.e. if someone passed 0.5)
results._comment3: NOTE 2: IF type IS PRESENT, THE JSON OBJECT WILL **NEVER** BE IMPLICITLY DESERIALIZED
